reviews.review: this game is honestly pretty fun if you have people to play with. I would recommend this to if you and your friends are looking to play a new game I would wait for a sale though I don't think its worth the 20$.

Más de 2400 horas de juego (50% Asesino / 50% Superviviente) HOY NO LO RECOMIENDO.  


La última actualización fue un desastre. Totalmente desbalanceado.

Emparejamiento pésimo.

Partidas con mucho lag.

Mapas como Racoon City por rediseñar (quién sabe cuándo).

Tuneleo y campeo constantes (sin penalización ni motivo).

Modificación de habilidades delirante y perjudicial para superivivientes.

Bugs de todo tipo.

Rubber banding.

Sistema de calificación - reporte  post-partida inútil (está pero no sirve para nada).

Un largo etc.

Dead by Daylight is an asymmetrical cat and mouse game that remains the mainstay in its genre; outliving both the Ash Vs Evil Dead and Friday the 13th games by long shots. I would highly recommend, and here is why;

[*] This game is for a type of person who doesn't seem to get angry easily, or can take the bad with the good. ("I died, but I still pipped/got my teammates out/had fun" or "Man, that 3k was good, they played well for hatch."
[*] Even with the toxicity, the game is loads of fun if not taken seriously and tryharded to death. 
[*] Finding a good group to play with as a survivor is amazing.
[*] Playing Killer is truly satisfying a good majority of the time, and the Killers just received a buff during the mid-season update.

This game will teach you to temper your expectations, get less tilted at perceived 'BS' and allow spend time enjoying the salt from those less fortunate than yourself.

como persona que ya tiene un tiempo jugando este juego, diria que es un juego divertido jugandolo con o sin amigos , el tema de las perks es un complemento curioso en donde te puede veneficiar o perjudicar dependiendo el asesino haciendo que lo pienses 2 veces antes de elegir una perk, en el tema de los personajes me molesta un poco el hecho que te demores en desbloquearlos y que se sienta que tienes que pagar para desbloquearlos, aunque con las colaboraciones no me quejo, quisiera siquiera otra manera aparte de subir de nivel para poder desbloquearlos,pero en general me gusta su jugabilidad, su comunidad , sus activos desarrolladores y los streemers que suben su contenido (psdt: este es mi primera reseña)

I have known this game since its early release and started playing in 2019. Many things have changed over the years, and this game was notorious for terrible updates, toxic community, and a long wait just for a simple change like the mori and legion to be balanced. But after the recent updates, this game has become pretty good and its finally refreshing to see something grow from a tiny, unbalanced, unfun game to a fun game that most people can enjoy without yelling at each other at end chat. Not perfect but still better than what it used to be.

Update 6.1.0 has completely killed solo (and by proxy, duo) queuing. The developers have buffed killers in a way that the average player cannot survive without supremely good communication. To which the developers have not included any official means of communication in game with other players. There is no way to tell what your teammates are doing unless you have brought specific perks (Bond, Kindred, etc). The devs have balanced this game away from four random survivors trying to survive together. 

Let's not forget how the community has been reacting to this update either. Tunneling and Camping is more prevalent than it ever was. It was always an issue, but now with the every killer having a free stack of STBFL baked into their kit has made chases much more difficult for the average player. Killers have had 0.2 seconds of their attack animation recovery shaved off and survivors lost 0.2 seconds of their speed boost when hit. These numbers don't sound like much but 0.4 seconds is a substantial amount of time, especially when many killers already have abilities that can shut down loops or chases. Survivors are now disconnecting and/or killing themselves the moment they get caught by the killer at alarming rates. Practically every single game there's a disconnect or somebody kills themselves. Once a survivor does either of those things, the game is practically already over if there are 3+ generators left. 

On top of nerfing part of the survivors base kit, they also fundamentally changed what is considered to be the biggest survivor crutch perk in the game: "Dead Hard". Before, if you were injured and not exhausted, you could press "E" for a slight dash forward and invulnerability for half a second. BHVR has removed the dash forward element and the perk no longer grants invulnerability, instead granting endurance for 0.5 seconds. This perk is practically worthless now as it pretty much has to be timed perfectly which is way to inconsistent on even a good connection, let alone a bad one.

Playing Killer right now is easier than it's ever been. Even the most mediocre killers can 4k most games now as all it takes is to down one person and the game starts to crawl to a halt from there. It's not fun for most killers either, there's very little challenge going up against three survivors with five generators left after one of them inevitably kills themselves.

Even if you have a team of four and you know nobody is a weak link, the games in this patch are all horrifically boring. Increasing the generator repair time from 80 seconds to 90 seconds is such a band-aid programmer fix to balance the game. Facing Thanataphobia Legion/Plague slows the game down even more. It's so eye gaugingly bad that survivors will instantly DC when they see it. Right now the meta is disconnecting.

This update was not healthy for the game. Killer queue times have increased because people don't want to play survivor anymore. We play games to have fun. Not to watch that Meg kill herself on first hook because she couldn't loop the killer like she used to. It's not uncommon for survivors to not even be able to do two generators as pretty much every killer is using 2+ perks that slow down the game significantly.

The developers stated that the reason they made these changes is because the global kill rate was not high enough. Despite the fact that the global kill rate average was above 52% for every single killer except some of the more mechanically advanced killers (who are already top tier, they are just hard to master). I might be missing something but a quote-unquote draw on average every game is fairly balanced, no? I really think this patch needed more time in the oven.

As of 7/29/2022, BHVR has made a statement saying that they do not want to make any knee-jerk reactions which is fair from a developer perspective, but is such non-answer to many people's problems with the update. I love this game, but so many games on this patch have been insanely frustrating to the point where I can only play one before I want to stop playing. I'm curious to see what the developers actual response is to this situation.
This game makes me rage yet I still come back.

This game can make me laugh, cry, and rage at the same time. Despite the update and how people are complaining about how dead hard and decisive are bad now, this game is still good. Never used dead hard or decisive personally so never affected me. 

(Besides suffering solo queue with teammates DC'in over something obscene) 
ps learn to laugh off a match with a camping Bubba. It's easily counter-able as long as you don't kill yourself on hook.

I have very mixed feelings about this game. The gameplay itself is a blast and super replayable, the content from cosmetics to characters are well designed, and the servers and match making have gotten way better since release. On the other hand, the balancing in this game has been terrible. When first getting into the game survivors will have a terrible time and honestly with the new patch its only gotten worse. Also, the game devs have recently made camping and tunneling much worse which goes against the original design for the game. They had made so many updates to reduce the issues but have time and time again changed thing that make them issues again.

Despite it's release in 2016, this game is still going strong with a dedicated community. A great game to play with friends to relive "freeze tag" when you were younger but with a twist! The game has it's ups and downs like many every patch but the team does a decent job in keeping it solid. After all, your survivability or lack there of will be based on your skills and quick thinking. Killers may seem a bit "over powered" but all have their weaknesses. If you do play killer, the same would apply - wits is your best friend.

Antes de mais nada, este é um jogo que ou você joga de forma cooperativa ou joga como killer, porque surv que não ajuda o time joga como segundo killer. Dito isso, DBD é um jogo muito bom. Você precisa estar concentrado, pensando constantemente e atento ao ambientes que você pode usar para loopar o killer. Claro, se você não for jogar agarrado em um gerador, que é a parte mais chata que existe, mas que tem as skills checks para te deixar atento ainda assim. Quando comecei, o coração disparava junto com as batidas do killer se aproximando. Depois acostumei a experiência foi ficando mais tranquila kkkk como pontos negativos eu indico o PING, que sempre gera uns hits inexistentes, e alguns problemas com bug que te deixam com ódio. Mas nada é perfeito né? Para quem está começando, indico jogar com a perk do gatinho e da janela de oportunidades, para saber os loops. Nunca use o evasão urbana, é podre!
